definitions.definition: The track cut out by a scythe in mowing.
A broad sweep or expanse , such as of land or of people.
examples: A large swath of the population is opposed to this government policy.
Five days after Hurricane Katrina, large swaths of New Orleans are still submerged in water.

main_definition: The track cut out by a scythe in mowing.
secondary_definitions: ( often figuratively ) A broad sweep or expanse , such as of land or of people.
